help.title: How to Use Running Calculator
help.intro: The Running Calculator helps you calculate distance, time, and pace for your runs. You can use it in two modes: manual mode or auto mode.
help.manualSteps: Fill in any two fields and click the calculate button next to the third field:
help.distanceCalcDesc: Enter time and pace, then click the distance calculate button
help.timeCalcDesc: Enter distance and pace, then click the time calculate button
help.paceCalcDesc: Enter distance and time, then click the pace calculate button
help.autoDescription: In auto mode, lock a field to keep it constant while automatically calculating the other fields as you type.
help.step1: Click the lock icon next to any field to lock it
help.step2: The locked field becomes constant (shown with a filled lock icon)
help.step3: Type values in the other fields - calculations happen instantly!
help.lockProtection: Locked fields are protected in auto mode
help.lockProtectionDesc: You can only lock fields with values. In auto mode, locked fields appear grayed out and cannot be edited. Switch to manual mode to edit any field. The lock is automatically released if the field becomes empty.
help.lockDistanceDesc: Distance stays constant. Change time or pace to calculate the other.
help.lockTimeDesc: Time stays constant. Change distance or pace to calculate the other.
help.lockPaceDesc: Pace stays constant. Change distance or time to calculate the other.
help.timeFormatsDesc: The calculator supports multiple time formats:
help.preciseTimeNote: Enable "Precise time" mode to use tenths of seconds in calculations.
help.racePredictorDesc: The Race Predictor uses Jack Daniels' Running Formula to predict your race times at different distances based on your current performance.
help.racePredictorSteps: Enter a distance and time in the Calculator tab. The app calculates your Performance Index (PI) and predicts times for standard race distances.
help.racePredictorFormulaDesc: where v is velocity (m/min), t is time (minutes), i is intensity, and PI is Performance Index
help.racePredictorNote: Note: Predictions assume similar training, conditions, and effort level. Actual results may vary.
help.tip1: Use auto mode with locked fields for quick "what-if" scenarios - lock your target pace and see how distance affects time.
help.tip2: Only one field can be locked at a time. Locking a new field automatically unlocks the previous one.
help.tip3: Switch to manual mode if you need to edit a locked field, then switch back to auto mode to continue auto-calculation.
help.tip4: The Speed ↔ Pace Converter helps convert between pace (min/km or min/mi) and speed (km/h or mph).
help.tip5: Switch between metric and imperial units in the settings to match your preference.

racePredictor.title: Race Predictor
racePredictor.enterData: Enter distance and time in the Calculator tab to get race predictions, or manually enter a Performance Index above.
racePredictor.description: Based on your performance index, here are predicted times for various race distances:
racePredictor.note: Note: Predictions are based on Jack Daniels' Running Formula using the Riegel/Cameron performance model. Actual race times may vary based on training, conditions, and course difficulty.

trainingPaces.title: Training Paces

trainingPaces.description: Based on your performance index, here are recommended training paces for different workout types:
trainingPaces.note: Note: Training paces are based on Jack Daniels' Running Formula. Adjust based on your current fitness, training goals, and environmental conditions.
